Player History
Had first career hit on 7/19/1966, off Bill Singer (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/28/1966, off Luis Tiant (BAL)...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Kansas City on 7/13/1967...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Minnesota on 8/1/1969...
Injured on 8/16/1969 with a Pulled Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 5/17/1971 with a Herniated Disc Back, out for 4-5 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Detroit on 7/20/1971...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1971, hitting .533 with 1 HR, 7 RBI...
Traded from New York (A) to Chicago (N) on 1/31/1972 (Going to NYY: P R. Jones. Going to CHC: RF B. Murcer)...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/27/1972, hitting .522 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Injured on 10/4/1973 with a Strained Thigh Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Chicago (N) in 1975...
Drove in 6 runs against Philadelphia on 4/9/1978...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Atlanta on 5/24/1978...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 6/28/1979, off Catfish Hunter (ATL)...
Injured on 7/10/1980 with a Fractured Finger, out for 3 weeks...
